intro: Hieracium villipes, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and hairy, while the flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium villipes is often considered a weed but can provide nectar for pollinators.
